name: John L. Brooks
bio: John L. Brooks is a renowned chef who has made a name for himself in the culinary world. Born and raised in the United States, Brooks developed a passion for cooking at a young age. He began his career as a line cook in several restaurants, where he honed his skills and gained valuable experience.

recipes.name: Khao Mok Gai
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
recipes.method: Marinate the chicken in the yogurt for at least 1 hour. In a large skillet, heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. Add the spices and cook for another minute. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and naan bread.

recipes.name: Khao Pad
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, marinate the chicken with yogurt, cream, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and fry until golden brown. Add marinated chicken and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy has thickened. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Phrik Kaeng Phet – Red Curry
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt. Add water gradually, and knead to make a smooth dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, garam masala, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and stir in ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and cilantro.Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a thin circle. Cut each circle into two equal parts.Take one half circle and form a cone. Fill the cone with vegetable mixture and seal the edges. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan over medium heat. Fry the samosas until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

name: Ian Kittichai
bio: Ian Kittichai, a culinary expert, is ranked second among the top ten Thai cooks. He is a gourmet expert, inventor, and TV personality who has won several awards. He constantly pushes the boundaries of foods and customs with his vast collection of restaurants, cookbooks, events, and consulting all over the globe.

recipes.name: Khao Kluk Kapi
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine shrimp, curry powder, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and salt. Toss to coat.Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add shrimp and cook for 3-4 minutes or until they turn pink. Stir in diced tomatoes and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Serve curry shrimp over cooked white rice. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Khao Kha Moo
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, whisk together yogurt, lemon juice, paprika, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, salt, garlic, and ginger. Place chicken leg quarters in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour the yogurt mixture over the chicken and massage the bag to evenly coat the chicken. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Remove chicken from the bag and place on the prepared baking sheet. Discard the remaining marinade. Drizzle vegetable oil over the chicken and use a brush to evenly coat the chicken. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy. Serve tandoori chicken hot with your choice of sides.

recipes.name: Pad Kra Pao
recipes.method: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the rice and stir. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed. While the rice is cooking, place the eggs in a saucepan and cover them with cold water. Bring to a boil and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the water and rinse the eggs under cold water. Peel the eggs and set aside and a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the onion, red and green bell pepper, and garlic. Cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant. Stir in the diced tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5-10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Add the peeled hard-boiled eggs to the skillet and gently stir them into the sauce. Simmer for 2-3 minutes or until the eggs are heated through. Serve the Madras curried eggs hot with the cooked rice. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

name: Apirawat Chaopo
bio: Chef Mai spent three years at Mandarin Oriental Bangkok's Le Normandie, honing his skills under the guidance of three Michelin-starred chefs. His passion for food and other culinary methods sprang from this. Everything on the platter, he believes, must be edible, gorgeous, and delightful.

recipes.name: Chickpea & Potato Curry with Rice
recipes.method: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the curry powder and stir until fragrant. Add the diced potatoes and cook until slightly softened. Drain and rinse the chickpeas and add them to the pan. Add the coconut milk and simmer until the potatoes are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala with Rice
recipes.method: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger, cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and add to the bowl with the yogurt mixture. Stir to coat the chicken evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight. Preheat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly oil the foil. Thread the chicken onto skewers and place on the prepared baking sheet. Broil for 6 to 8 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the cream and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve the chicken tikka masala with the rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooked Curry Chicken with Rice
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, bone-in, skin removed
recipes.method: In a slow cooker, combine chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, coconut milk, curry powder, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 3-4 hours, until chicken is tender and cooked through. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Cauliflower Tikka Masala
recipes.method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, olive oil, garam masala, paprika, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Add cauliflower florets to the bowl and toss to coat with the yogurt mixture. Arrange the coated cauliflower on a baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender and slightly charred.Meanwhile, heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.Stir in diced tomatoes and heavy cream, and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the roasted cauliflower to the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Simmer for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

name: Christopher Barlee
bio: Christopher Barlee is an accomplished chef with over two decades of experience in the culinary world. He has a passion for modern British cuisine and sustainable cooking practices, striving to create dishes that not only taste great but also have a positive impact on the environment. Barlee has worked in a variety of roles within the hospitality industry, including executive chef and culinary consultant. He is dedicated to using locally sourced ingredients and reducing food waste, while also incorporating innovative cooking techniques to push the boundaries of traditional cuisine.

recipes.name: Som-Tam
recipes.method: In a mortar and pestle, pound garlic and Thai chilies into a paste. Add the sugar and continue to pound until dissolved. Add fish sauce and lime juice, and mix together. In a large mixing bowl, combine the shredded papaya, carrots, and cherry tomatoes. Add the dressing to the mixing bowl and toss everything together until well combined. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. Add crushed peanuts to the top of the salad before serving.

recipes.name: Laab Moo Isan
recipes.method: Begin by toasting the rice powder in a dry pan over medium heat until it turns golden brown. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl, mix together the minced meat, lime juice, fish sauce, mint leaves, shallots, and chili flakes. Use your hands to mix the ingredients together thoroughly. Once the rice powder has cooled, add it to the meat mixture and stir to combine. Taste the laab and adjust the seasoning if necessary, adding more lime juice, fish sauce, or chili flakes as needed. Serve the laab with sticky rice and fresh vegetables, such as lettuce leaves, sliced cucumbers, and bean sprouts.

recipes.name: JOK MOO
recipes.method: Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 20 minutes until softened. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl, mix together the fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and red pepper flakes to make the sauce. Set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and shallot and stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant. Add the chicken, shrimp, and tofu and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until cooked through. Push everything to one side of the pan and pour the beaten eggs into the empty side. Scramble the eggs until cooked, then mix everything together. Add the soaked noodles and sauce to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the noodles are heated through and coated in the sauce. Add the bean sprouts and green onions and stir-fry for an additional minute. Serve the Pad Thai hot, garnished with the crushed roasted peanuts. Enjoy!

name: Lightfoot Alexis
bio: Lightfoot Alexis is a chef and food blogger based in the United States. She is known for her plant-based recipes and vegan lifestyle content, which she shares on her popular Instagram page and blog. Lightfoot's approach to cooking is centered around creating healthy, delicious meals that are accessible and easy to prepare. She is also a wellness advocate, promoting the benefits of a plant-based diet and lifestyle. Through her online platform, Lightfoot has built a large following and is considered a leading voice in the vegan and plant-based community.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
ingredients: 8 oz. protein (such as shrimp, chicken, or tofu), chopped
recipes.method: Soak the rice noodles in hot water for 10-15 minutes until softened. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the tamarind paste, fish sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce, and cayenne pepper. Set aside. Heat a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil and swirl to coat the pan. onions and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened. Divide the Pad Thai among plates and top with chopped peanuts. Serve with lime wedges on the side. Squeeze the lime over the Pad Thai before eating. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Pad See Ew
ingredients: 1/2 lb. protein (such as chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, or tofu)
1-2 cups Chinese broccoli or other vegetables
recipes.method: Soak the fresh rice noodles in hot water for 10-15 minutes until soft. Drain and set aside. Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add 1 tbsp. of oil and swirl to coat the pan. Add the protein (chicken, beef, pork, shrimp, or tofu) to the pan and stir-fry until cooked through.small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper. Add the sauce mixture to the pan and stir-fry everything together for 1-2 minutes until the sauce is evenly distributed. Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Kuay Teow Neua
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt. Add water gradually, and knead to make a smooth dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, garam masala, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and stir in ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and cilantro.Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a thin circle. Cut each circle into two equal parts.Take one half circle and form a cone. Fill the cone with vegetable mixture and seal the edges. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan over medium heat. Fry the samosas until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.

name: Wadham Riley
bio: Wadham Riley is a chef and food blogger based in the United States. She is known for her plant-based recipes and vegan lifestyle content, which she shares on her popular Instagram page and blog. Lightfoot's approach to cooking is centered around creating healthy, delicious meals that are accessible and easy to prepare. She is also a wellness advocate, promoting the benefits of a plant-based diet and lifestyle. Through her online platform, Lightfoot has built a large following and is considered a leading voice in the vegan and plant-based community.

recipes.name: Pla Plao
ingredients: 1 whole Pla Plao (Mackerel or Tilapia fish)
recipes.method: Clean the fish thoroughly and make a few diagonal cuts on both sides of the fish. Rub some salt all over the fish and let it sit for 10-15 minutes. Preheat your grill or oven to 400°F. Brush the fish with some vegetable oil and place it on the grill or in the oven. Cook the fish for 20-25 minutes or until it is cooked through and the skin is crispy. While the fish is cooking, prepare the sauce. In a small bowl, mix together the minced garlic, fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and chopped chili peppers. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning according to your preference. Once the fish is done, remove it from the grill or oven and place it on a serving plate. Pour the sauce over the fish and sprinkle chopped cilantro on top. Serve hot with steamed rice and some vegetables on the side.

recipes.name: Khao Niao
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, marinate the chicken with yogurt, cream, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and fry until golden brown. Add marinated chicken and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy has thickened. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Kuay Teow Neua
recipes.method: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, 2 tablespoons oil, and salt. Add water gradually, and knead to make a smooth dough. Cover with a damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds, and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add mixed vegetables, turmeric, garam masala, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and stir in ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and cilantro.Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a thin circle. Cut each circle into two equal parts.Take one half circle and form a cone. Fill the cone with vegetable mixture and seal the edges. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan over medium heat. Fry the samosas until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with mint chutney or tamarind chutney.
